Pass by const reference?

std::thread takes arguments by value/rvalue only. Taking a reference would be dangerous as the arg could go out of scope before it's used in the thread.\n\nEdit: Thinking more about this, std::thread's constructor turns references into copies anyway, so I suppose a const reference here would just extend the lifetime of the copy as usual.
I also read that the reference is turned into a copy, but I figured it's better to be explicit about it being a copy. I also didn't use a pointer because dealing with its lifetime is not worth it.\n

I didn't mention it on your first PRs because I didn't want to scare you away, but we've _just_ agreed to change our code style from hungarian to snake_case. Mind updating? See https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/doc/developer-notes.md.\n\nDon't worry about changing everything around this code, just what you're touching.

Please rename this so that they're more clear, since this is exposed outside of CConnman now.\nconnOptions.vConnect -> connOptions.m_specified_outgoing\nconnOptions.bNoConnect -> (!) connOptions.m_use_addrman_outgoing

All outbound connections are moving to one thread soon, but for now, we should return an error if connOptions.m_use_addrman_outgoing && !connOptions.m_specified_outgoing.empty().\n\nAlso, If addrman isn't being used for outgoing and there are no specified connections (incoming connections only), we can just skip creating the thread completely.
I also prefer it this way, explicitly.
